did.abstract: Unaddressed 1792 letter from John Stagg, Jr. to an unidentified military officer requesting that he and his troops prepare for detachment to Trenton, N.J. before moving on to headquarters in Pittsburgh, PA.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: John Stagg, Jr. (1758-1803) served as a captain and lieutenant in the Continental Army during the Revolutionary War, and was also General George Washington's private secretary at Valley Forge, PA. Following the War, Stagg was a clerk in the U.S. War Office for eight years, and was elected sheriff of New York City in 1801.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unaddressed letter from John Stagg, Jr. to an unidentified military officer requesting that he and his troops prepare for detachment to Trenton, N.J. before moving on to headquarters in Pittsburgh, PA. It is dated December 1, 1792.
